agenda.description: ** REVISION ** SENATE NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Natural Resources & Economic Development TIME & DATE: 9:00 AM, Thursday, April 4, 2019 PLACE: E1.012 (Hearing Room) CHAIR: Senator Brian Birdwell SB 320 Flores Relating to the use of municipal hotel occupancy tax revenue in certain municipalities. SB 1262 Johnson Relating to the allocation of hotel occupancy tax revenue collected by certain municipalities. SB 1270 Watson Relating to the eligibility of certain exhibitions and festivals to receive funding through the Major Events Reimbursement Program. SB 1307 Taylor Relating to the use of hotel occupancy tax revenue by certain municipalities, including the authority to pledge certain revenue for the payment of obligations related to hotel projects. SB 1393 Seliger Relating to the use of municipal hotel occupancy tax revenue in certain municipalities. SB 1431 Fallon Relating to the eligibility of certain events to receive funding through the Major Events Reimbursement Program. SB 1467 Hughes Relating to the use of municipal hotel occupancy tax revenue in certain municipalities. SB 2137 Hinojosa Relating to the use of municipal hotel occupancy tax revenue by certain municipalities. SB 2182 Nelson Relating to the eligibility of certain events for funding under the Major Events Reimbursement Program. SB 2208 Nichols Relating to the use of hotel occupancy tax revenue by certain counties. Public testimony will be limited to 2 minutes. If submitting written testimony, you must include your name or the name of your organization on each copy, and you must likewise email a digital copy to the clerk of the committee. Bills added after last posting: SB 320 ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions of the schedule **
